definition: To depict or represent someone or something visually, capturing their likeness or characteristics through artistic or photographic means. This term is commonly employed in the context of creating portraits of individuals, whether through painting, drawing, or photography.

examples.german: Er porträtierte seine Familie in einem Gemälde.
examples.english: He portrayed his family in a painting.

examples.german: Die Schauspielerin wurde in dem Film sehr gut porträtiert.
examples.english: The actress was portrayed very well in the movie.

examples.german: Der Autor porträtierte den Charakter mit großer Detailgenauigkeit.
examples.english: The author portrayed the character with great attention to detail.

examples.german: Die Zeitschrift porträtierte den berühmten Musiker in ihrer Titelgeschichte.
examples.english: The magazine portrayed the famous musician in their cover story.

examples.german: Der Fotograf porträtierte das Model vor einem beeindruckenden Hintergrund.
examples.english: The photographer portrayed the model against an impressive backdrop.
